medical_history.chief_complaint: Abdominal pain and intractable nausea and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient developed acute onset nausea and vomiting, followed by abdominal pain. Symptoms began last week and have included multiple episodes of non-bloody, non-billious, clear emesis per day. Abdominal pain is cramping/burning in nature, located in the right upper quadrant (RUQ) and epigastrium, worsening with retching. Patient has had minimal oral intake since the onset of symptoms.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Diabetes Mellitus Type II (DMII), Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD), morbid obesity, depression, low back pain (LBP), lumbar disk displacement.
